Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Droop cup; interior glazed black with narrow reserved band low on lip; exterior: lip glazed with narrow reserved band at base; band at top of handle zone which has black-figure decoration body; below, black figure decoration consisting of chariot to right (top of head of two horses with trace of added red on neck, part of reins, bridles with added white dots, and part of goad remaining); nonsense inscriptions in field.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Ure places the cup within his Droop Cups group C or E.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 42, pl. XXI, no. 26)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 427, no. B678)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 271, no. 6ter)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1414) (phase 3)
